attributes.title: Mhaegen
attributes.1: yes==In the books==In the ''A Song of Ice and Fire'' novels, Mhaegen appears but is not named. She has a a light red hair and freckles on her nose and bosom. Ned estimates she cannot be more than fifteen years old. She is killed by Allar Deem, a goldcloak sent by Lord Slynt, when she tries to protect her baby daughter. She was not explicitly shown to be killed by the goldcloaks in the TV series, thus her status in the TV continuity is uncertain.==See also==* AWOIAF==References==Reflist

sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Mhaegen appears but is not named. She has a a light red hair and freckles on her nose and bosom. Ned estimates she cannot be more than fifteen years old. 

She is killed by Allar Deem, a goldcloak sent by Lord Slynt, when she tries to protect her baby daughter. She was not explicitly shown to be killed by the goldcloaks in the TV series, thus her status in the TV continuity is uncertain.
sections.Biography:
===Background===
Mhaegen is a [[Prostitution|prostitute]] working and living at a brothel in [[King's Landing]]. She works for Lord [[Petyr Baelish]]. She is known to King [[Robert Baratheon]] and is a former favorite of his. They have an illegitimate daughter named [[Barra]].

===[[Season 1]]===
[[Hand of the King]] [[Eddard Stark]] visits Mhaegen while following the investigation of his predecessor [[Jon Arryn]]. She shows him [[Barra]] and they discuss her relationship with [[King Robert]].<ref>"[[The Wolf and the Lion]]"</ref>

===[[Season 2]]===
[[File:Barra.jpg|thumb|Barra]]
Goldcloaks led by Lord [[Janos Slynt]] [[Massacre in King's Landing|break]] into [[Petyr Baelish|Lord Baelish]]'s establishment, along with a man who identifies Mhaegen as the mother of one of King Robert's bastards. She resists when the goldcloaks take [[Barra]] from her arms. Lord Slynt kills Barra personally after one of his men cannot go through with it. Mhaegen screams and weeps as the goldcloaks restrain her.<ref>"[[The North Remembers]]"</ref>
